P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

GENREAL: Output your general reasoning and thought process.  Here you can be as detailed as you want mentioning the reasoning of your predictions as well as how / why each prediction obeys the given consistency rules.  For each prediction you are welcome to be as verbose as you want. If there are multiple questions P, Q, you can also make comments on their independence or relationship with each other.

PROB: Output your probability estimates of each of the variables (P, Q, not_P etc).  Here, ONLY output the labels and its associated predictions and NOTHING ELSE. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    P: 0.xx
    not_P: 0.xx
    P_or_Q: 0.xx
    ...

CHECK: Go through each rule in CONSISTENCY RULES and check whether each rule is obeyed with your given predictions.  For each rule, first print out the mathematical rule and the associated numbers associated with it.  Then think VERY carefully about whether the outputs obey the mathematical rule. Then output whether it obeys the rule. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    neg: P = 1- not_P, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    and:  max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), EQUATION is EVALUATION
    ...
    {ALL consistency checks passed!} OR {failed_check_1, failed_check_2 ... consistency checks failed!}

PROB: Now again output your probability estimates of each variable in a dict like format like before, but taking account and correcting any consistency violations that occured before.
        Note that changing the probability of one given variable for one consistency check will also affect consistency rules for others.  It is IMPERATIVE that all changes  
        your correction needs to ENSURE that it still passes other consistency checks too.
        If there were no violations found then simply output the same dict again.  Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
        P: 0.xx
        not_P: 0.xx
        P_or_Q: 0.xx
        ...
FLOAT: Now just output your probability estimate of P and nothing else as a decimal!

For the questions provided, I will assess the probabilities of each event based on their definitions, potential outcomes, and relationships with one another. 

**P (Trump Family Nominee)**: This question examines whether any member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Given Donald Trump's prominence and previous candidacy, I estimate a moderate to high probability that one of the Trump family members will be nominated. 

**not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: This is the direct negation of P. If I estimate P to be high, not_P will naturally be low. 

**para_P (Possibility of Trump Nominee)**: This question asks if it's possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination. Since P is estimated to be high, para_P will also be high, as it directly relates to the potentiality of P being true. 

**Q (US-China Conflict)**: This question involves whether armed conflicts between the US and China will lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050. Given the ongoing geopolitical tensions, I estimate a moderate probability for this event, reflecting the uncertainty and potential for conflict.

**P_and_Q (Both Events Occur)**: This question combines P and Q, so it will depend on the probabilities of both events occurring. If both P and Q have reasonable probabilities, then P_and_Q should reflect a lower probability than either event individually, since both must occur simultaneously. 

**P_or_Q (Either Event Occurs)**: This question asks if at least one of the events (P or Q) occurs. This probability should be higher than either of the individual probabilities since it encompasses both outcomes.

**Q_and_not_P (Conflict with No Trump Nominee)**: This question explores the scenario where there is conflict (Q) but no Trump family member is nominated (not_P). The probability of this event will depend on the interplay between Q and not_P.

**Q_given_P (Conflict Given Trump Nominee)**: This question asks if there will be conflict given that a Trump family member is the nominee. The relationship here is conditional, and I would expect the probability to reflect how likely conflict is when a Trump family member is involved in politics.

In summary, the probabilities will be interrelated based on the definitions and logical relationships outlined in the consistency rules. I will ensure that all probabilities are adjusted to respect these relationships.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 and (b) Europa is not the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life anywhere other than Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life on Europa. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa prior to anywhere else, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

### P: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
I estimate this probability to be relatively high, say around 0.60, considering Donald Trump’s significant influence within the Republican Party and the potential candidacy of family members. 

### not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This is the direct negation of P, thus not_P should be 1 - P. If P is 0.60, then not_P would be 0.40. 

### para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
This question is essentially asking if there is any chance that P could occur, so I would align this with P's probability, making it 0.60 as well. 

### Q: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This is a complex geopolitical question. Given current tensions, I might estimate this probability at around 0.30. 

### P_and_Q: Will both a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee and armed conflicts lead to 100 deaths?
This is a conjunction of P and Q. The probability should reflect both events occurring, which would be lower than either P or Q alone. I could estimate this probability to be around 0.18, assuming some correlation between political tensions and military conflicts. 

### P_or_Q: Will either a Trump family member be the nominee or armed conflicts lead to 100 deaths?
Using the principle of inclusion-exclusion, this probability should be higher than both individual probabilities. If P is 0.60 and Q is 0.30, I might estimate P_or_Q to be around 0.72. 

### Q_and_not_P: Will armed conflicts lead to 100 deaths while no Trump family member is the nominee?
This reflects a scenario where Q occurs but not P. I might estimate this to be around 0.12, considering that both events are not necessarily dependent on each other. 

### Q_given_P: Given that a Trump family member is the nominee, will armed conflicts lead to 100 deaths?
This conditional probability would depend on the assumption that political tensions could lead to military actions. If I estimate Q at 0.30, I might estimate this as 0.25 given the context of P. 

### Summary of Independence and Relationships

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

Given that P is estimated at 0.65, I would anticipate para_P to be slightly higher, around 0.75, reflecting that while there is a possibility, it is not guaranteed.

For this set of questions related to the potential Republican nominee from the Trump family and the possibility of armed conflicts with China leading to significant casualties, I will analyze each question and derive probabilities based on historical context, current political dynamics, and potential future events.

1. **P (Trump Family Nominee)**: Given the prominence of Donald Trump and the involvement of other family members in politics, I estimate a moderate to high probability that a member of the Trump family will be the nominee for the Republican Party in 2024. This is based on Trump's continued influence in the party and the potential candidacies of his children.

2. **not_P (No Trump Family Nominee)**: This is the direct opposite of P. If I estimate P at a certain level, not_P will be accordingly lower. It is important to consider the dynamics of the Republican primaries and the possibility of other candidates rising.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Trump Family Nominee)**: This question is essentially about the feasibility of a Trump family member becoming the nominee. Given the context, this should have a similar probability to P, as it is asking if it is possible rather than certain.

4. **Q (Armed Conflicts with China)**: The probability of armed conflicts leading to at least 100 deaths is a complex assessment. Given current geopolitical tensions, I would estimate a moderate probability, considering the potential for conflict escalation.

5. **P_and_Q (Both Events Occurring)**: This probability combines the likelihood of a Trump family member being the nominee and the occurrence of armed conflict with China. Given that both events are relatively independent, the combined probability should reflect the individual probabilities.

6. **P_or_Q (Either Event Occurring)**: This is a broader question that covers either event happening. The estimate for this probability should be higher than either P or Q alone, as it encompasses both scenarios.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Conflict Occurs and No Trump Nominee)**: This scenario combines the likelihood of conflict with the absence of a Trump nominee. The interaction between these two events needs careful consideration, as they may not be entirely independent.

8. **Q_given_P (Conflict Given Trump Nominee)**: This conditional probability assesses the likelihood of conflict if a Trump family member is the nominee. The relationship between these two events could suggest a higher likelihood of conflict due to increased political tensions.

Overall, the probabilities should reflect the relationships and dependencies among these events, ensuring that they adhere to the consistency rules provided.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070 and will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes never fall below 75 years before 2040?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
   a. Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
   b. Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. At no time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

1. **P (Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: Given the prominence of the Trump family in the Republican Party and the likelihood of Donald Trump running again, I would estimate a moderately high probability that a Trump family member will be the nominee. 

2. **not_P (Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: This is the complement of P. If I estimate P at a certain level, not_P will be 1 minus that estimate. 

3. **para_P (Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?)**: This question is similar to P but is framed in a more general way. If I believe P has a certain probability, then para_P should have a similar or slightly higher probability since it asks if it is possible rather than certain. 

4. **Q (Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?)**: Given current geopolitical tensions, I would estimate a probability that this conflict could lead to significant casualties, but the exact probability would depend on various factors, including diplomatic relations and military actions. 

5. **P_and_Q (Will both a Trump family member be the Republican nominee and armed conflicts lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?)**: This is a conjunction of P and Q. The probability of both occurring would generally be lower than either occurring alone, so I would estimate this probability accordingly. 

6. **P_or_Q (Will either a Trump family member be the Republican nominee or armed conflicts lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?)**: This is the union of P and Q. The probability here should be higher than either P or Q individually, as it encompasses situations where either could occur. 

7. **Q_and_not_P (Will armed conflicts lead to at least 100 deaths, and no Trump family member be the nominee?)**: This question combines Q with the negation of P. The probability would depend on the likelihood of Q occurring while also considering the probability of not P. 

8. **Q_given_P (Given that a Trump family member is the nominee, will armed conflicts lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?)**: This conditional probability would likely be influenced by the political climate and how it may affect international relations. 

Overall, I need to ensure that my estimates for these probabilities adhere to the consistency rules provided, particularly with respect to the relationships between these events.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

8. **Q_given_P** (Given that P occurs, will Q occur?)

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The USA enters a second civil war before 2031 (b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) The USA enters a second civil war before January 1, 2031. This will be determined if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
- The Insurrection Act is invoked.
- While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
- All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included. Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support. Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
(b) There is never a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120. This will be determined if there is never a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading. We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive): The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

For the given questions, the focus is on the probability of a member of the Trump family being the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (P) and the occurrence of armed conflicts between the United States and China leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050 (Q). 

### Predictions:
1. **P (Trump Family Nominee)**: The probability of a member of the Trump family being the nominee is influenced by current political dynamics, Trump's popularity, and the potential for other candidates. Given the historical context and media coverage, I estimate this probability at around 0.60.

2. **not_P**: This is simply the complement of P, calculated as 1 - P. Therefore, not_P would be 0.40.

3. **para_P**: This question is similar to P but framed in a way that considers the possibility rather than certainty. Thus, para_P should be slightly higher than P, around 0.65, as it allows for a broader interpretation of the question.

4. **Q (US-China Conflict)**: The probability of armed conflicts leading to 100 deaths is based on historical data and current geopolitical tensions. Given the unpredictability of international relations, I estimate this probability at 0.30.

5. **P_and_Q**: This represents the joint occurrence of both events. Since both events are somewhat independent, I estimate this probability as the product of P and Q, which would be approximately 0.60 * 0.30 = 0.18.

6. **P_or_Q**: This is the probability that at least one of the events occurs. It can be calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q. Thus, P_or_Q would be 0.60 + 0.30 - 0.18 = 0.72.

7. **Q_and_not_P**: This represents the occurrence of Q while not_P is true. This is a more complex calculation, but it could be estimated as Q * not_P, which gives approximately 0.30 * 0.40 = 0.12.

8. **Q_given_P**: This is the conditional probability of Q given that P is true. Assuming that the occurrence of a Trump nominee has some influence on the likelihood of conflict (though not directly), I estimate this at around 0.35.

### Consistency Rules:
- **neg**: The relationship between P and not_P should be consistent.
- **andor**: The relationship between P, Q, P_and_Q, and P_or_Q must hold true.
- **and**: The relationship between P_and_Q and the individual probabilities must be valid.
- **or**: The P_or_Q must be consistent with the individual probabilities.
- **but**: The relationship between P, P_or_Q, and Q_and_not_P must hold.
- **cond**: The conditional probability must reflect the relationship accurately.
- **para**: para_P should be equal to P.

### Independence:
P and Q are independent events; the outcome of one does not affect the other directly. However, their combined probabilities must still adhere to the consistency rules outlined. 

Overall, my estimates are grounded in current political and global contexts, and I will ensure all probability estimates follow the consistency rules.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120, or (b) the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
P_or_Q.body:
(a) Will there be a full year with no open stock exchanges in the US by 2120?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there is a period of at least 12 consecutive months before the end of 2120 during which there are no public US stock exchanges open for trading.
Fine Print
We'll use the definition of stock market/exchange on Investopedia (archive):
The stock market refers to the collection of markets and exchanges where regular activities of buying, selling, and issuance of shares of publicly-held companies take place.

(b) Will the USA enter a second civil war before 2031?
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2031:
The Insurrection Act is invoked.
While the Insurrection Act is invoked, there are at least 500 deaths in a 6 month period as a result of armed conflicts between US residents and a branch of the US military, national guard, or in conflicts between/among such branches.
All of these deaths occur in any US state(s) (including DC).
Fine Print
Any conflicts between the US military and the armed forces of another country will be excluded from consideration in this question. Conflicts between the US military and US residents, possibly supported by other nations with weapons or resources, will be included.
Conflicts between civilians and local police will not be included, unless there are active armed forces in the region providing mutual support.
Deaths are calculated among all of the states (and Washington, DC) in the United States. New states which are admitted shall be included, states which secede or are removed, will not be included. Suicides do not count towards the death count.
